definition: gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)
soul/mortal soul, i.e. attached to the body

sentences.english: With youth and blood, courage and wisdom to complete the arduous task.
sentences.chinese: 用青春和熱血，膽魄與智慧完成了艱鉅任務。

sentences.english: Software engineers are the guts of every company we are invested in.
sentences.chinese: 我們投資的每家公司的軟件工程師都很有膽魄。

sentences.english: With youth and warm blood, bravery soul and wisdom finished formidable job.
sentences.chinese: 用青春和熱血，膽魄與智慧完成了艱鉅任務。

definition: to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
to trust one another fully/to treat sb with sincerity
lit. as round as pearls and as smooth as jade (idiom)/fig. elegant and polished (of singing or writing)
after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
both the guests and the hosts thoroughly enjoy themselves (idiom)
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to make a significant advance in one's career (idiom)/to get one's big break
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
